name: muffling
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
muffle
muffle verb [T]
(MAKE LESS CLEAR)
to make a sound quieter and less clear: The house has double-glazed windows to muffle the noise of aircraft.
to make something less strong or clear: The report concluded that business pressure on the government had muffled the impact of the legislation.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Becoming and making less strong
muffle verb [T]
(KEEP WARM)
to wear thick warm clothes in order to keep warm: I was muffled up against the cold in a scarf and hat.
